about_the_game:
What is the iVRy for SteamVR (Pico App Installer) DLC?


• It is the installer for the iVRy app for Pico Mobile headsets.

What is iVRy (Pico Edition)?


• iVRy is an app for your Pico Mobile headset with a Virtual Reality headset driver for SteamVR.

What does that mean?


• Want to play PC VR* (Virtual Reality) titles without having to buy another VR headset?
• With iVRy and a Pico Mobile headset you can!
• Supports Wired (USB) connections for greater visual quality and performance.
• Supports Wireless (Wifi) connections for greater mobility.
• Automatically adjusts quality to maintain optimal frame rates on all connection types.
• User configurable quality and performance options.
• Integrates with SteamVR, so no 'manager' / 'server' apps or additional configuration required.
• Includes SteamVR Dashboard overlay, to change driver settings in VR.
• Built-in support for NoloVR 6DOF tracking and motion controllers.
• Compatible with most HTC Vive and Oculus Rift** titles.
• "Lite" edition has all of the features of "Premium" edition, but will start to reduce color saturation after being connected for more than 5 minutes. Upgrade to "Premium" edition via Steam DLC to remove this limitation.

* Valve OpenVR/SteamVR. Requires Valve Steam & SteamVR on Windows 7 or later.
** Oculus Rift titles require Valve SteamVR, Oculus Home & 3rd party 'LibreVR Revive' software.

SteamVR


Before you start

IMPORTANT:

Before using the iVRy Driver for SteamVR, the iVRy Pico app MUST be installed on the Mobile Device. To do so, enable USB File Transfers or USB Debugging on the device, connect it via a USB cable to the PC and select the "Install Pico Mobile App" Launch option of the iVRy Driver for SteamVR.

For details on how to enable Developer Mode and USB Debugging on your device, refer to:

If installing via USB File Transfer, you will need to install the iVRy-pico.APK file via the File Manager app on the Pico Mobile headset (set type to APK).

To start the app on your Pico Mobile headset, use the link in the "APP Library" menu.

On startup the app will display "Waiting for Connection", while it waits for the iVRy Driver for SteamVR to connect. SteamVR can be launched from the iVRy "Launch" button, or by launching SteamVR or a SteamVR/OpenVR VR title.

When using the iVRy Driver for SteamVR for the first time, it MUST be started from the "Launch" button, to ensure any additional services and drivers it requires get installed.

To connect the app via USB, you will either need to enable USB debugging on the Pico device, or USB tethering. USB tethering can be enabled via iVRy settings on the device. To open iVRy settings, press the 'app' button on the left controller while the app is displaying "Waiting for Connection".


Pico Neo3

NOTE:


Due to issues with the Pico Neo 3 PUI 4.x system software, it is recommended to upgrade to the PUI 5.x system software.
